isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - FLYWHEEL RECONDITIONING - RING GEAR REPLACEMENT

note.para: Effective with S/N 544287, all flywheels are equipped with a chamfered ring gear. The chamfer facilitates the engagement of the starter pinion into the flywheel. The new ring gear will replace the old and is a direct interchange without modification of existing parts or components.

step1.para: Remove any damaged ring gear from the flywheel as follows:

step2.para: Heat the ring gear with a torch to expand the gear.
Once heated, knock the gear off the flywheel. DO NOT HIT THE FLYWHEEL WHEN REMOVING THE RING GEAR.

step1.para: Install a new ring gear as follows:

step2.para: Heat the new ring gear evenly until the gear expands enough to slip onto the flywheel.
Make sure the ring gear is seated properly against the flywheel shoulder.

note.para: DO NOT HEAT THE RING GEAR TO A TEMPERATURE HIGHER THAN 500° F (278° C). HEATING BEYOND 500° F WILL ADVERSELY AFFECT RING GEAR HARDNESS.
